snippet: The move by the fund is part of an effort to provide swift assistance as part of a larger four-year bailout.
abstract: International Monetary Fund's board approves $17.5 billion loan to Ukraine, with $10 billion to be pumped into its troubled economy over the next year; loan is part of larger four-year bailout that will also include expected $15.4 billion in debt relief.
lead_paragraph: The move by the fund is part of an effort to provide swift assistance as part of a larger four-year bailout.

headline.main: I.M.F. Plans $10 Billion in New Aid to Ukraine
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Plans $10 Billion in New Aid to Ukraine
